generif.text: To determine the extent of promoter hypermethylation in early lung tumorigenesis, we analyzed promoter methylation status of the p16, death-associated protein kinase (DAPK) and glutathione S-transferase P1 (GSTP1) genes
upregulated significantly in acute myeloid leukemia patients whose white blood cell count was higher than 100 x 10(9)/L cells

positive regulation of autophagic cell death

name: death associated protein kinase 1

reactome.name: Caspase activation via Dependence Receptors in the absence of ligand
Caspase activation via extrinsic apoptotic signalling pathway

summary: Death-associated protein kinase 1 is a positive mediator of gamma-interferon induced programmed cell death. DAPK1 encodes a structurally unique 160-kD calmodulin dependent serine-threonine kinase that carries 8 ankyrin repeats and 2 putative P-loop consensus sites. It is a tumor suppressor candidate. Alternative splicing results in multiple transcript variants. [provided by RefSeq, Dec 2013].
